comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to books.google.com/books?id=hw0UAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA85&lp... and many other sources, William A. Orr was private secretary to Governor Charles Seymour Whitman.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: His wife is the former Hazel Louise Earhart; they married in 1909. Their children are William E., Robert, and Doris Louise--at the time of this photo, maybe the youngest of those hasn't quite been born yet.... William Earhart Orr (1910-1965) would be the older child here. He was in the Navy. He's buried at Fort Rosecrans National Cemetery in San Diego: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=Orr&am...; Doris Louise Orr (d. 2002) attended Wellesley and married to William Spencer Doig (b. 1913) in 1940. They had two children, Elizabeth (1942) and James (1943). Here's her obituary: www.conwaydailysun.com/node/125299/18668 Between college and marriage, she served a secretary to movie producer David O. Selznick.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: New-York tribune., December 15, 1914, Page 5 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1914-12-15/ed-... has a picture of him and a brief bio -- and confirms his appointment by Whitman.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: His entire professional background was as a newspaperman, so I wonder if his job wasn't more as what we would now call a press secretary? From the 1916 New York Red Book:

comment._content: Thanks swanq and pennylrichardsca for the providing his full name the identities of his family. We will update our records.
